de.wwu.muggl.instructions.typed
Class TypedInstruction

java.lang.Object
  de.wwu.muggl.instructions.typed.TypedInstruction
Direct Known Subclasses:
ByteInstruction, CharacterInstruction, DoubleInstruction, FloatInstruction, IntegerInstruction, LongInstruction, ReferenceInstruction, ShortInstruction
public abstract class TypedInstruction
extends java.lang.Object

This abstract class is to be extended by all classes that offer static methods for typed instructions. A lot of the bytecode instructions have the same function, but address diferent types. I common, those instructions are available for References (prefix a), Doubles (d), Floats (f), Integers (i) and Longs (l). Some are also available for Bytes (b), Characters (c) and Shorts (s). Beside the definition of abstract methods, it offers both static and instance methods for type checking. Last modified: 2008-09-16

Version:
1.0.0
Author:
Tim Majchrzak

getDesiredType

public abstract java.lang.String getDesiredType()
Get a String representation of the desired type of this instruction. This method is used to check whether the fetched Object is an instance of the desired type.

Returns:
A String representation of the desired type.

checkDesiredType

public boolean checkDesiredType(java.lang.String objectref)
Check if the objectref is of the desired type.

Parameters:
objectref - The objectref to check.
Returns:
true, if the objectref is the desired type, false otherwise.

getDesiredSymbolicalTypes

public abstract int[] getDesiredSymbolicalTypes()
Get a int representation of the desired symbolic type of this instruction as defined in de.wwu.testtool.structures.environment.object.SymbolicVirtualMachineElement. This method is used to check whether the fetched Object is an instance of the desired symbolic type.

Returns:
The int representation of the wrapping type, or -1 if there is no such type.
See Also:
SymbolicVirtualMachineElement.BYTE, SymbolicVirtualMachineElement.CHAR, SymbolicVirtualMachineElement.DOUBLE, SymbolicVirtualMachineElement.FLOAT, SymbolicVirtualMachineElement.INT, SymbolicVirtualMachineElement.LONG, SymbolicVirtualMachineElement.SHORT

getNewVariable

public abstract de.wwu.testtool.expressions.Variable getNewVariable(Method method,
                                                                    int localVariable)
Get a new variable for the symbolic execution.

Parameters:
method - The Method the variable is a parameter of.
localVariable - The index into the local variables (required for the correct naming of the variable generated).
Returns:
An instance of Variable without a super term set.

getDesiredTypes

public abstract java.lang.String[] getDesiredTypes()
Get a String array representation of the desired types of this instruction. This method is used to check whether the fetched Object is an instance of one of the desired types.

Returns:
A String representation of the desired type.

validateAndExtendValue

public java.lang.Object validateAndExtendValue(java.lang.Object value)
                                        throws ExecutionException
Validate the value and extend if it necessary.

Parameters:
value - The (probably extended) value to check.
Returns:
true, if value is of one of the desired types, false otherwise.
Throws:
ExecutionException - If the supplied value does not match the expected type, an ExecutionException is thrown.

extendValue

protected java.lang.Object extendValue(java.lang.Object value,
                                       java.lang.String type)
Extend the value if this is required by its' type. For most inheriting instructions this is not needed, so the default behavior is to just return the suplied value.

Parameters:
value - The object that might need to be extended.
type - The type of the object, which determines the extension strategy.
Returns:
The (probably extended) value.

validateAndTruncateValue

public java.lang.Object validateAndTruncateValue(java.lang.Object value,
                                                 java.lang.Object arrayref,
                                                 Frame frame)
                                          throws ExecutionException,
                                                 VmRuntimeException
Validate and truncate the value. In general, it only is checked if the value has the correct type. For some inheriting instructions it is truncated then. This methods can be overridden. It however is only overridden by class AAstore, since the aastore instruction requires a more complicated way of checking the value.

Parameters:
value - The value that is to be stored into an array.
arrayref - The array reference.
frame - The currently executed frame.
Returns:
The (probably truncated) value.
Throws:
ExecutionException - If the supplied value does not match the expected type, an ExecutionException is thrown.
VmRuntimeException - If a runtime exception happened and should be handled by the exception handler.

validateReturnValue

public java.lang.Object validateReturnValue(java.lang.Object value,
                                            Frame frame)
                                     throws ExecutionException,
                                            VmRuntimeException
Validate a return value. The validateValue()-Method is used to archive this.

Parameters:
value - The value that is to be returned.
frame - The currently executed frame.
Returns:
The value.
Throws:
ExecutionException - If the supplied value does not match the expected type, an ExecutionException is thrown.
VmRuntimeException - If a runtime exception happened and should be handled by the exception handler.

truncateValue

protected java.lang.Object truncateValue(java.lang.Object value,
                                         java.lang.String type)
Truncate the value if this is required by its' type. For most inheriting instructions this is not needed, so the default behaviour is to just return the suplied value.

Parameters:
value - The object that might need to be truncated.
type - The type of the object, which determines the truncation strategy.
Returns:
The (probably truncated) value.

validateAndTruncateSymbolicValue

public de.wwu.testtool.expressions.Term validateAndTruncateSymbolicValue(de.wwu.testtool.expressions.Term term,
                                                                         java.lang.Object arrayref,
                                                                         Frame frame)
                                                                  throws SymbolicExecutionException,
                                                                         VmRuntimeException
Validate and truncate the value. In general, it only is checked if the value has the correct type. For some inheriting instructions it is truncated then. This methods can be overridden. It however is only overridden by class AAstore, since the aastore instruction requires a more complicated way of checking the value.

Parameters:
term - The term that is to be stored into an array.
arrayref - The array reference.
frame - The currently executed frame.
Returns:
The (probably truncated) term.
Throws:
SymbolicExecutionException - If the supplied value does not match the expected type, an ExecutionException is thrown.
VmRuntimeException - If a runtime exception happened and should be handled by the exception handler.

truncateSymbolicValue

protected de.wwu.testtool.expressions.Term truncateSymbolicValue(de.wwu.testtool.expressions.Term term,
                                                                 int type)
Truncate the symbolic value if this is required by its' type. For most inheriting instructions this is not needed, so the default behaviour is to just return the suplied value.

Parameters:
term - The Term that might need to be truncated.
type - The type of the Term, which determines the truncation strategy.
Returns:
The (probably truncated) term.

getStringRepresentationForWrappedType

public static java.lang.String getStringRepresentationForWrappedType(int wrappedType)
Get the String value corresponding for a int value of a wrappedType of the Term class.

Parameters:
wrappedType - The int value representing the wrapped type.
Returns:
The String representation for the wrapped type, or null, if the wrappedType is not recognized.

generateVariableNameByNumber

public static java.lang.String generateVariableNameByNumber(Method method,
                                                            int number)
Returns a suitable String representation of this variable. If parameter names are available, the corresponding parameter name will be used. Otherwise, a name will be generated depending on the number supplied. In this case the output will be: - first a-z - then aa to az - then ba to zz - then aaa to zzz - etc.

Parameters:
method - The Method the variable belong to.
number - The number of this variable. Same numbers mean same variables.
Returns:
The variable name of the variable at position number in the supplied method, or a suitable variable name for the number supplied if there are no names specified.
